definition: incorruptible/honest/inexpensive/to investigate (old)/side wall of a traditional Chinese house (old)
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]

sentences.english: Low-priced goods of good quality are always in short supply.
sentences.chinese: 商品價廉物美，總是供不應求。

sentences.english: This television is quite cheap and have a good qaulity.
sentences.chinese: 這架電視機真是價廉物美。

sentences.english: This is because these are more affordable and some are even more durable.
sentences.chinese: 這是因爲他們更加的價廉物美，更加經久耐用。

sentences.english: The goods that flow freely must be good and cheap.
sentences.chinese: 該商品銷勢極好想必一定價廉物美。

sentences.english: Therefore cheaper and qualitative imports from the region is also benefiting Indian economy.
sentences.chinese: 日本與馬來西亞的產品價廉物美，能讓印度經濟受益。

sentences.english: And, there are a lot of good, cheap restaurants all around universities.
sentences.chinese: 而且，學校周圍也會有許多價廉物美的小飯館。

sentences.english: They are to be had very cheap and good . we breathe but the air of books.
sentences.chinese: 書笈價廉物美，不啻我們呼吸的空氣。

sentences.english: We all understand that Chinese shippers are very popular in your market on account of their superior quality and competitive price。
sentences.chinese: 我們都知道中國拖鞋因價廉物美而暢銷於你方市場。

sentences.english: This typewriter is very cheap and fine indeed.
sentences.chinese: 這部打字機真是價廉物美。

sentences.english: We all know that Chinese slippers are very popular in your market since they have superior quality and competitive prices.
sentences.chinese: 我們都知道中國拖鞋因價廉物美而脫銷於你方市場。

sentences.english: Cheap and cheerful they may be, but incandescent bulbs have one huge weakness.
sentences.chinese: 儘管白熾燈價廉物美，它們有一個巨大的缺點。

sentences.english: Chinese fruits are very popular in the market on account of their superior quality and competitive price.
sentences.chinese: 中國水果因價廉物美而暢銷於市場。

definition: proletariat/abbr. for 普羅列塔利亞|普罗列塔利亚[pu3 luo2 lie4 ta3 li4 ya4] plus masses/also written 無產階級|无产阶级[wu2 chan3 jie1 ji2] in PRC Marxist theory
reasonably priced/inexpensive/to keep prices down/(currency exchange) parity
